newsitem.title: JORDAN: Iraq's defence minister treated in Jordan hospital.
newsitem.headline: Iraq's defence minister treated in Jordan hospital.

text.p: Doctors at a Jordanian hospital have operated on Iraqi Defence Minister General Sultan Hashim Ahmed to remove an abscess, a hospital official said on Wednesday.
The official at the King Hussein Medical City hospital said Ahmed was admitted on Monday and was expected to make a full recovery.
"It was a minor thing. He is in good condition," the official told Reuters. He gave no details of the operation.
He said the minister had been brought to Amman because doctors in sanction-hit Baghdad lacked the equipment to give a reliable diagnosis when he was taken ill.
Doctors said the scan he underwent before the operation -- Magnetic Resonance Imaging -- suggested the absess was likely to have been on his brain.

Unusual activity at the hospital on Monday prompted a wave of rumours in Amman that Iraqi President Saddam Hussein's son Uday, injured in a gun attack four months ago, had come to Jordan for treatment.
But the official said he had not been admitted.
A wheelchair-bound Uday said in a television interview last month that Iraqi and French doctors would soon operate on his left leg.
